page.title: 11Pencombe Fete / 3.
page.content: This year's special attraction is a display of Morris dancing.Many teams from far afield,take part in a colourful dancing display. The day comes to an end at around 4:30p.m.When the people leave to return home and the stalls are taken down. This year attendance was disappointing,being mainly attributed to the cold,wet summer of 1985.The takings however were in the region of Â£600. The fete is organised by the local fete committee,{Mrs.S.Townsend}being in charge. Half of the money raised is used by Pencombe Church and the remainder is split up for use by the Village Hall and the village Primary School.
